header: Criminal Bail Application No. 216/2019 (CNR No. MHPU01­000783­2019) Dattatraya Bhimaji Golande & others Vs. State of Maharashtra (Through Shikrapur P.S.)

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 Applicants – Dattatraya Bhimaji Golande, Mangala Dattatraya Golande, Kiran Dattatraya Golande and Mohini @ Janata Kiran Golande have filed this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for the grant of Anticipatory Bail in connection with C.R.No. 6/2019, Shikrapur P.S., under Section 406, 420, 467, 468, 471 r/w. 34 of the Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of the code of criminal procedure
under section 406, 420, 467, 468, 471 r/w. 34 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: [2] Perused the application and say filed by I.O. I have heard both the sides and perused the material placed on the record.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Perused the application and say filed by I.O. I have heard both the sides and perused the material placed on the record.

arguments.text: [3] On 08.01.2019 the complainant Shantaram Nanaware filed complaint against the applicants and other 63 persons alleging that, the applicants and other co­accused committed conspiracy and took Rs. 5 Lakhs by assuring to get job in Public Work Department as a clerk and issued bogus appointment letter. The amount paid for securing job not returned to him and cheated him. According to him, the relatives of complainant and the villagers were cheated by the applicants and other co­accused and took the amount of Rs. 3,18,00,000/­ and issued false appointment letter. The said amount given to Sachin Patil and Maruti Shinde by co­accused Golande. They filed complaint at Hinjewadi Police Station, Pune vide C.R No. 276/2016 against Sachin Patil and Maruti Shinde regarding cheating. The accused had paid the amount of Rs.1,35,00,000/­ to the peoples, who had given money for securing job. The remaining amount of Rs.1,83,00,000/­ is yet to be recovered from the accused person. When complainant and others asked the accused to return the money, thereon, they refused to pay the remaining amount, abused them and give threat on life. On these allegations, the applicants and other co­accused were prosecuted.

argumentSentences.text: [3] On 08.01.2019 the complainant Shantaram Nanaware filed complaint against the applicants and other 63 persons alleging that, the applicants and other co­accused committed conspiracy and took Rs. 5 Lakhs by assuring to get job in Public Work Department as a clerk and issued bogus appointment letter.
The amount paid for securing job not returned to him and cheated him.
According to him, the relatives of complainant and the villagers were cheated by the applicants and other co­accused and took the amount of Rs. 3,18,00,000/­ and issued false appointment letter.
The said amount given to Sachin Patil and Maruti Shinde by co­accused Golande.
They filed complaint at Hinjewadi Police Station, Pune vide C.R No. 276/2016 against Sachin Patil and Maruti Shinde regarding cheating.
The accused had paid the amount of Rs.1,35,00,000/­ to the peoples, who had given money for securing job.
The remaining amount of Rs.1,83,00,000/­ is yet to be recovered from the accused person.
When complainant and others asked the accused to return the money, thereon, they refused to pay the remaining amount, abused them and give threat on life.
On these allegations, the applicants and other co­accused were prosecuted.

arguments.text: [4] The Ld. counsel for the applicants submitted that, the applicants have no concern with the amount, given by the said persons to Sachin Patil and Maruti Shinde. To put pressure and to threaten the applicant, Jaysingh Aadak and Vikas Dafal threatened co­accused on 26.09.2017 that if they will not return the said amounts, they will cut their hands and legs. Hence, other co­accused have lodged N.C. against said persons, with Hinjewadi Police Station on 26.09.2017. On 01.05.2018 he also lodged N.C. Complaint against said persons u/s. 507 of I.P.C. Similarly, like complainant, some persons also demanding money from present co­accused. Due to their harassment and though complainant himself, he cheated complainant has returned Rs.1,32,00,000/­ by selling his ancestral land. The applicants are nowhere concerned with the said transaction.

argumentSentences.text: [4] The Ld. counsel for the applicants submitted that, the applicants have no concern with the amount, given by the said persons to Sachin Patil and Maruti Shinde.
To put pressure and to threaten the applicant, Jaysingh Aadak and Vikas Dafal threatened co­accused on 26.09.2017 that if they will not return the said amounts, they will cut their hands and legs.
Hence, other co­accused have lodged N.C. against said persons, with Hinjewadi Police Station on 26.09.2017.
On 01.05.2018 he also lodged N.C. Complaint against said persons u/s. 507 of I.P.C. Similarly, like complainant, some persons also demanding money from present co­accused.
Due to their harassment and though complainant himself, he cheated complainant has returned Rs.1,32,00,000/­ by selling his ancestral land.
The applicants are nowhere concerned with the said transaction.

arguments.text: [5] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required. Nothing incriminating has to be discovered or recovered at the instance of applicants. Hence, prayed for anticipatory bail.

argumentSentences.text: [5] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence.
The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required.
Nothing incriminating has to be discovered or recovered at the instance of applicants.
Hence, prayed for anticipatory bail.

arguments.text: [6] On the other hand, the Ld. APP submitted that there is prima facie accusation against this applicants. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is required for purpose of investigation. The applicants and another co­accused cheated the complainant and others and obtained huge money to secure the job. The remaining amount is yet to be recovered. He may tamper the prosecution evidence. It submitted that, looking to the gravity of the offence, the application is liable to be rejected.

argumentSentences.text: [6] On the other hand, the Ld. APP submitted that there is prima facie accusation against this applicants.
The custodial interrogation of the applicants is required for purpose of investigation.
The applicants and another co­accused cheated the complainant and others and obtained huge money to secure the job.
The remaining amount is yet to be recovered.
He may tamper the prosecution evidence.
It submitted that, looking to the gravity of the offence, the application is liable to be rejected.

arguments.text: [7] After considering this submission of both the sides and perusing the material placed on record, it reveals that there is prima facie accusation against the applicants. The huge amount was obtained from several persons to secure the job in Government Service. The remaining amount is yet to be recovered. The applicants and other co­accused cheated several persons and committed breach of trust. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is required for the purpose of fair investigation. Therefore, it is not desirable to release the applicants on anticipatory bail. Hence, I proceed to pass the following order

argumentSentences.text: [7] After considering this submission of both the sides and perusing the material placed on record, it reveals that there is prima facie accusation against the applicants.
The huge amount was obtained from several persons to secure the job in Government Service.
The remaining amount is yet to be recovered.
The applicants and other co­accused cheated several persons and committed breach of trust.
The custodial interrogation of the applicants is required for the purpose of fair investigation.
Therefore, it is not desirable to release the applicants on anticipatory bail.
Hence, I proceed to pass the following order

order.text: O R D E R [1] Application (Exh.1) is rejected. [2] Ad­interim protection granted is hereby vacated.

footer: Sd/­ Pune ( G.P.Agrawal ) Date : 29/01/2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. CERTIFICATE I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : Smt. S.N.Kale Name of Court : G.P.Agrawal Addl. Sessions Judge,Pune. Order delivered on : 29/01/2019 Order signed on : 29/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 30/01/2019
processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No. 216/2019 (CNR No. MHPU01­000783­2019) Dattatraya Bhimaji Golande & others Vs. State of Maharashtra (Through Shikrapur P.S.) 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 Applicants – Dattatraya Bhimaji Golande, Mangala Dattatraya Golande, Kiran Dattatraya Golande and Mohini @ Janata Kiran Golande have filed this application under Section 438 of the Code of Criminal Procedure for the grant of Anticipatory Bail in connection with C.R.No. 6/2019, Shikrapur P.S., under Section 406, 420, 467, 468, 471 r/w. 34 of the Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
[2] Perused the application and say filed by I.O. I have heard both the sides and perused the material placed on the record. 
---argument-ends---
[3] On 08.01.2019 the complainant Shantaram Nanaware filed complaint against the applicants and other 63 persons alleging that, the applicants and other co­accused committed conspiracy and took Rs. 5 Lakhs by assuring to get job in Public Work Department as a clerk and issued bogus appointment letter. The amount paid for securing job not returned to him and cheated him. According to him, the relatives of complainant and the villagers were cheated by the applicants and other co­accused and took the amount of Rs. 3,18,00,000/­ and issued false appointment letter. The said amount given to Sachin Patil and Maruti Shinde by co­accused Golande. They filed complaint at Hinjewadi Police Station, Pune vide C.R No. 276/2016 against Sachin Patil and Maruti Shinde regarding cheating. The accused had paid the amount of Rs.1,35,00,000/­ to the peoples, who had given money for securing job. The remaining amount of Rs.1,83,00,000/­ is yet to be recovered from the accused person. When complainant and others asked the accused to return the money, thereon, they refused to pay the remaining amount, abused them and give threat on life. On these allegations, the applicants and other co­accused were prosecuted. 
---argument-ends---
[4] The Ld. counsel for the applicants submitted that, the applicants have no concern with the amount, given by the said persons to Sachin Patil and Maruti Shinde. To put pressure and to threaten the applicant, Jaysingh Aadak and Vikas Dafal threatened co­accused on 26.09.2017 that if they will not return the said amounts, they will cut their hands and legs. Hence, other co­accused have lodged N.C. against said persons, with Hinjewadi Police Station on 26.09.2017. On 01.05.2018 he also lodged N.C. Complaint against said persons u/s. 507 of I.P.C. Similarly, like complainant, some persons also demanding money from present co­accused. Due to their harassment and though complainant himself, he cheated complainant has returned Rs.1,32,00,000/­ by selling his ancestral land. The applicants are nowhere concerned with the said transaction. 
---argument-ends---
[5] The Ld. Counsel for Applicants stated that, the applicants are innocent and have not committed any offence. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is not required. Nothing incriminating has to be discovered or recovered at the instance of applicants. Hence, prayed for anticipatory bail. 
---argument-ends---
[6] On the other hand, the Ld. APP submitted that there is prima facie accusation against this applicants. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is required for purpose of investigation. The applicants and another co­accused cheated the complainant and others and obtained huge money to secure the job. The remaining amount is yet to be recovered. He may tamper the prosecution evidence. It submitted that, looking to the gravity of the offence, the application is liable to be rejected. 
---argument-ends---
[7] After considering this submission of both the sides and perusing the material placed on record, it reveals that there is prima facie accusation against the applicants. The huge amount was obtained from several persons to secure the job in Government Service. The remaining amount is yet to be recovered. The applicants and other co­accused cheated several persons and committed breach of trust. The custodial interrogation of the applicants is required for the purpose of fair investigation. Therefore, it is not desirable to release the applicants on anticipatory bail. Hence, I proceed to pass the following order 
---argument-ends---
O R D E R [1] Application (Exh.1) is rejected. [2] Ad­interim protection granted is hereby vacated. 
---order-ends---
Sd/­ Pune ( G.P.Agrawal ) Date : 29/01/2019 Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. CERTIFICATE I affirm that the contents of this P.D.F. file order are same word to word as per original order. Name of Steno : Smt. S.N.Kale Name of Court : G.P.Agrawal Addl. Sessions Judge,Pune. Order delivered on : 29/01/2019 Order signed on : 29/01/2019 Order uploaded on : 30/01/2019
